oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee Copper Mine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Aerial view of the Tennessee Copper Mine.

In 1899, the Tennessee Copper Company was incorporated and chartered by the Lewisohn Brothers, and work began that year on the mining properties and clearing the land for the development of plants. Prior to this, the area had already been used by the copper mining industry. Eventually, the ecological devastation of the area led to it being considered the largest man-made biological desert in the country and also brought about the first study on the long-term effects of acid rain.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Copper industry; Aerial views; Industrial facilities
